creator: jekormanslp

title: FF PDF viewer stymied by multiple blanks
content:
Using this PDF as an example, open it in FF and search for regional development (one space). It finds no hits when I do this.

If I search for regional development (two spaces), it finds one hit.

If I search for regional development (three spaces), it finds one hit.

If I open the PDF in Chrome or in Adobe Reader and search for regional development (one space), it finds two hits, treating the intervening spaces as one space.

I think FF should work like Adobe Reader and Chrome in this regard.
creator: van.knowles

title: ATUALIZAR
content: PORQUE EU NÃO CONSIGO ATUALIZAR O NAVEGADOR?
creator: anacristinajg561

title: Google Maps goes black (again)
content:
Since a few days, when I visit Google Maps, after completely loading the page (roads and buildings shown for a brief moment) the map becomes wholly black with just captions still readable.

Doing the following didn't fix: Restart Firefox. Update Nvidia Drivers (updated yesterday to 466.11, didn't resolve). Disable every add-on and setting default theme. Disable Hardware Acceleration from settings.

THIS temporarily fixed: Entering Firefox Troubleshoot mode.

So I assume the problem is in advanced settings. There are TONS of settings there. Any ideas? I 'd rather not go through a Firefox Refresh losing all site permissions/fine tuning for cookie settings/blocked content for every site made in years. I'm on Firefox 88, Windows 10 64bit ver. 2004, GeForce 950M, Core i7-4720HQ, 16GB RAM.


I put "again" in the title since another question about this is marked as solved for Firefox 68/69. Needless to say, I tried everything from that discussion (such as switching gfx.webrender.all), to no avail for the present issue.
creator: madclarky

title: digital certificate
content:
Good morning! I have just transferred a digital identity certificate from a pendrive to my computer and then carried out the importation process (outcome: "importation was successful") but I cannot find the certificate in the browser (at the following path: Internet options/privacy and security/security/certificates/see certificates). What am I doing wrong? Many thanks for your help.

Hola a todos: acabo de descargar un certificado digital de un pendrive a mi ordenador y he seguido los pasos para "importarlo" con el resultado " se ha importado con exito". Sin embargo, no lo encuentro en el almacen de certificados de Firefox (direccion: opciones internet/privacidad y seguridad/seguridad/certificados/ver certificados). Hago algo mal? Como puedo ver este certificado en mi ordenador? Muchas gracias por vuestra ayuda!

title: Firefox automatically connecting to multiple IP addresses. Is it a security issue?
content:
As soon as I start the Firefox Browser, it is connecting to multiple IP addresses. Any idea why it is doing so? Is there a way to stop it? Is it a privacy and security issue?

I have already changed most of the setting as mentioned in the following article: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-stop-firefox-making-automatic-connections

Some of the IP connections have stopped after making those changes. But there are still few connections. They are: - 35.244.181.201 (This is Google LLC) - 13.227.142.108 (This is Amazon) - 117.18.237.29 (This appears to be Verizon Media) - 54.70.109.38 (This is Amazon) - 52.38.31.225 (This is Amazon)

It will be great if someone could shed some light on this issue. Thanks in advance.

title: Can't connect to conferences in browser
content:
I am not able to join my universities online classes through Firefox. I thought it might be just an issue with the unis conference service, but I tried discord as well and it's the same problem. Stuff I have tried: look into the permissions options and resdet the permissions (didn't even ask me for pemission again), check if the "block new requests" is marked (never was), didn't help launching firefox in trobleshoot mode to see if it's one of the addons that is the root of my problem, but it didn't change anything.

The only thing that helped was to reset Firefox, but that only fixes it temorarily (about 3 days). After that it reverted back to not letting me join calls. Now I could keep resetting my broweser every three day, but that's a bit bothersome.
creator: martingraf.1998

title: Close multiple tabs menu
content:
Hi there,

I was wondering for the past few months if there is maybe someone at Firefox DEV/UI team who so much hates the Close multiple tabs menu item, that slowly but surely is getting to disappear?

  1. In the good ol days there was a separate menu item Close Tabs To The Right under the tab right click menu. Which was very useful and I used it a lot.
  2. Then this developer/designer from above, or some political committee decided that to remove that one and to put it as a submenu under a new menu item Close Multiple Tabs. That was outrageous, but I said well, maybe they have some weird reason behind this change so I should probably get used to the new version. In the end the Close Tabs To The Right menu item was still first in the list.
  3. Then since last week or two, I realized that this evil entity above decided to set the Close Tabs To The Right to be the second one in the list under the submenu! And this is too much! I've made like countless mistakes of closing the very important tabs on the left for the past few days by just wrongly assuming I'l clicking the right submenu item.

So guys and gals or aliens or whatever you are, what are you trying to do? Ruin the browser on purpose?

I'm using the Firefox for decades as my main browser, but it is getting worst and worst with every new release. And the reasons to still stay with it are diminishing. Which is sad...
creator: zoran.tanevski

title: Webpage opening error
content:
Of late, whenever I try to visit a website (known and legitimate), the Firefox browser leads me to the following webpage

"moz-extension://ee3befbe-85dd-4199-93d5-e0f2f1ccb0b6/content/ui/blockedPage.html?originalURL=http://iclickcdn.com/tag.min.js?aDcPgiD=1&aDgRpiD=93&tAgaDiD=433&nsVnM=ch2&blockPageType=IPS&IpsSignature=31349_31349"

which displays the message

"Malicious Site Blocked! You attempted to access: http://iclickcdn.com/tag.min.js?aDcPgiD=1 This webpage is a known malicious webpage. It is highly recommended that you do NOT visit this page. Visit Norton to learn more about phishing and internet security."

This happens ONLY with Firefox browser, it does not happen with the Microsoft Edge browser (for the same website)! hence, and apparently, not something to do with the Norton security software.

Please review and advise what goes wrong while using the Firefox Browser.

Thank you.

title: Firefox becomes intollerably slow
content:
In recent times, after I've been browsing for about 20 or 30 minutes, Firefox becomes very very slow to respond. Simultaneously it coincides with a similar slowdown over the entire computer - in finder and with other open programs. If I close Firefox (which takes several minutes to complete) the slowness of finder and the open programs disappears. The slowness never happens unless Firefox is open. I've tried Chrome and haven't had the same issue.

What might be causing this delayed slowness and how do I solve it?

title: How can I remove the search suggestions from the address bar but not disable searching?
content: I like using the address bar to search, but when I start typing an address I don't want the first thing between what I'm typing and the actual url that I can quick select to be 6 "search suggestions". Going into about:config and setting keyword.enabled false removes those search suggestions but it also stops the address bar search from working. Is there a setting that I can use to set the number of displayed suggestions to 0?

title: Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue: SSL_ERROR_BAD_CERT_DOMAIN
content:
Hi am getting the follow error when trying to go to Tumblr sub-domains i.e. https://roeyourboat-.tumblr.com/:

Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue

Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to roeyourboat-.tumblr.com because this website requires a secure connection.

What can you do about it?

roeyourboat-.tumblr.com has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You can’t add an exception to visit this site.

The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it. You can notify the website’s administrator about the problem.

Learn more…

Websites prove their identity via certificates. Firefox does not trust this site because it uses a certificate that is not valid for roeyourboat-.tumblr.com. The certificate is only valid for the following names: *.tumblr.com, tumblr.com

Error code: SSL_ERROR_BAD_CERT_DOMAIN

View Certificate

This Certificate looks like this:

https://roeyourboat-.tumblr.com/

Unable to communicate securely with peer: requested domain name does not match the server’s certificate.

HTTP Strict Transport Security: true HTTP Public Key Pinning: false

I can go Tumblr sub-domains just fine with Microsoft Edge, Chrome, Internet Explorer, Opera, and Safari on my Mac and PC (except Safari without error. I cannot find away of bypassing this in Firefox. Some Tumblr sub-domains work while others don't. I believe the answer to this is that the url contains a dash at the end of the sub-domain those that work properly do not contain the dash.
creator: gworley

title: Firefox built-in PDF viewer's display bug on Japanese and Chinese
content: My firefox version is 78.9-esr As attachment, Japanese and Chinese character will be messed up. I have tried to install different fonts like fonts-arphic-ukai and fonts-arphic-uming, but it still displays improperly. By the way, it can displays Japanese and Chinese in html correctly.
creator: wyt94yx

title: Font rendering issues
content:
Hi, i have font rendering issues on some websites.

I found out it has something to do with the Hardware Acceleration.

When I turn it off, everyting is ok.

However, then other websites which require more performance are really slow.

How can I fix the big without turning off hardware acceleration?

This website among others causes font issues with hardware acceleration ON:

https://www.lazada.vn/
creator: fireninja

title: Print Projects Only Print in the Left  top 1/4 Page
content:
I just bought an HP Officejet 9018. I tried printing a receipt that was sent as an attachment to my gmail. It only prints very small in the upper left hand corner even though the print preview looks normal. I tried to print a return label that Amazon sent me a link to. It printed the same way. I called HP & after connecting with my laptop & trying many different settings unsuccessfully, they had me try to print from Chrome. The attached receipt in gmail & the return label printed fine from Chrome. It also printed fine from my gmail in my Android phone & my iPad, so the issue is only when in Firefox on my Windows 10 computer. My saved documents print fine. I just updated to the latest Firefox today, but the issue started when I got the HP printer & tried to print while using Firefox 2 days ago.

I saw instructions in here on checking the paper_data. It shows letter. I changed from "fit to page width" to Scale 100. I still have the same issue. There was one other instructions given to someone in Mozilla Support to click "file" & then something else, but I have nothing on my page that says "file". I assume the person answering the question thought the person asking was trying to print a saved document, but that wasn't the case.

I tried to attach screen prints, but my laptop is having issues & isn't saving them for some odd reason, yet I can see them in the "recents" in Microsoft Word. I save them again, but the same thing. It isn't in the folder when I click "browse" on "Add images" below.

What else can I do? it's such a pain to have to go to Chrome every time I want to print something. Thanks
creator: goldenspring

title: webRTC stream makes firefox tab crash
content:
Hello. I am running Firefox 88.0 on macOS Catalina 10.15.7 to play a webRTC streaming from Wowza Streaming Engine. When playing a webRTC streaming, Firefox tab will crash and show "Gah. Your tab just crashed." The crash report is here. If I play the same streaming on other browsers (Chrome, Edge, Safari), this problem doesn't occur. Any help is appreciated.

title: The print scale is reset to the default value after selecting the item "Fit to page width".
content: I printed out the first document with a scale of 75%. For the second document, I chose "Fit to page width". After printing the second document, the zoom value changed to 100%. For the next print, I need to manually change the zoom to 75% again, because it has changed. It takes too much time.
creator: kosoruckov.oleg

title: Recover Bookmarks and Settings from Firefox 44.0
content:
I am installing Firefox version 88.0 on an Ubuntu Linux version 15.04 system. Currently, I had, Firefox version 44.0. I am installing from the downloaded tar file as follows:

/home/paulr/firefox/firefox -ProfileBuilder

How do I recover my bookmarks and settings at this point ?

What happened is Firefox came up and asked me to sign in to my account. I didn't have one so I created one and am signed into it now. I don't have another Firefox account to sync with.
